metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Gortash in his office.Possible outcomes:1. You visited Steel Foundry and the destroyed Control Centre - he attacks you.2. You visited Steel Foundry, didn't destroy the Control Centre, but someone activated Dead Man switch which destroyed Iron T hrone. He attacks you.3. You visited Iron Throne which caused the destruction of it. He tells you - "I warned you" and then attacks you.4. You didn't kill Orin. He attacks you.5. You killed Orin and you have both Netherstones.6. Fallback node which includes the case where you killed Orin, but didn't bring either of the netherstones. He attacks you.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Set Quest Flags & Options - Act 3 (WYR) - WYR Kill Director Gortash - Go To Gortash in his office (WITH Netherstones)

8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
8.text: I once saw value in our alliance. But you have proven most disloyal.

85.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
85.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.

139.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
139.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Steel Watch. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.
139.context: NodeContext: barely containing his anger - he's been betrayed, and is furious

32.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
32.text: We will meet under the city and take control of the brain. Then we will take our rightful place as its rulers.

46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
46.text: We could have been allies. Powerful ones. And yet -

59.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
59.text: You have the Netherstones - they resonate with my own.

4.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
4.text: I commend you for putting an end to Orin's madness - she must be screaming bloody murder in the Hells even now.
4.context: NodeContext: extremely pleased - Orin is a recently-slain enemy of his

76.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
76.text: How was the reunion? I trust you demonstrated your particular spark of creative genius?
76.context: NodeContext: referring to the player's sadistic streak - pleased they may have demonstrated it on somebody he hated

160.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
160.text: I always preferred your methods to hers. You have mastery over your Urges, Orin was consumed by her gruesome obsessions.
160.context: NodeContext: assuring that this is true - heavy emphasis on 'alawys'

137.speaker: Player
137.text: That's why I killed Orin, as promised in the terms of our pact.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: You talk like you're better than us, but you're a killer too.

63.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
63.text: I see murder as a grim necessity, to provoke a desired response from those who witness it. To Orin, it was a pleasurable pastime.
63.context: NodeContext: correcting a misconception about himself - he's no murderer, he's a politician

119.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
119.text: I don't even want to know what it is to you.
119.context: NodeContext: speaking about murder, to a mass murderer. hint of disgust

53.speaker: Player
53.text: The Chionthar will run red. It is time.

154.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
154.text: Then you know what must be done.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: This world can be ours, Gortash. We have Bhaal's blessing.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You're wrong, my Urges are only ever a step away from controlling me.

50.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
50.text: Bhaal allows you to pick your battles, as long as you do pick them. Orin thinks she needs to slash every throat in sight.
50.context: NodeContext: confident. 'bhaal' is the god of murder - he's speaking to an offspring of that god, and convincing them they are no tmonsters

15.speaker: Player
15.text: My Urges are gone from me, as is any trace of Bhaal.

2.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
2.text: I'm surprised Bhaal allowed you to slip away from his grasp. But this changes nothing.
2.context: NodeContext: slight surprise, but no concern

122.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
122.text: With me, you will have power greater than Bhaal could have given you, and you will bow to no master.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Atonement is what I seek now.

69.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
69.text: Whatever happened in that Temple, it doesn't change what you're guilty of, and the rewards your guilt will sow.
69.context: NodeContext: trying to get his conversation partner enthused when they seem downbeat

138.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
138.text: And you brought Karlach to heel. See that she remains obedient - my offer is not for her, it is for you.

88.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
88.text: But you have a chaotic streak of your own. You broke into my prison to rescue Karlach.
88.context: NodeContext: weighing up the person you're speaking to, and laying out their flaws

104.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
104.text: That angered me, I will not deny it. But it also showed courage - and I respect courage. We can work together, provided we build a foundation of trust -
104.context: NodeContext: rational, in control - interrupted by an earthquake on the last word

13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

133.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
133.text: The brain awakens - we must act now. Faithful, come forward.

20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Several Banites step from the corner shadows, one at a time. They look fierce and dangerous.

12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finally, the Steel Watcher stepw forward. It activates, looking devastatingly powerful.

170.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
170.text: Hand me the Netherstones, and we will rule as one.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Kill him and take his stone. The Grand Design cannot come to pass.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: Good idea. And let's trust the fox to safeguard the chicken coop, while we're at it.

152.speaker: Astarion
152.text: Call me cynical, but I'm not sure we can trust the god of tyranny's Chosen to happily share power.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: Do what he asks. My father's life is in his hands.

147.speaker: Gale
147.text: Hmm. I can think of more trustworthy accomplices - more than a few, in fact.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: If there was ever a moment to kill this fucker, this is it.

168.speaker: Halsin
168.text: We would struggle to find a less trustworthy creature.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: That is the royal 'we', I think. Little men do not like to share power.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Take the Netherstones. We will control the brain and reform the Sword Coast in our image.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: If we are to rule together, the stones should be split between us. I keep mine, you keep yours.

56.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
56.text: I'm not here for games. Hand me the stones, or face the black hand of Lord Bane.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: All right. No need for violence. Take the Netherstones.

143.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
143.text: You surrender your advantage too quickly. I did not expect such craven behaviour from one who faced Orin and lived.

117.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
117.text: Such a weak ally is of no use to me. I will have to repurpose you.

31.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
31.text: I think I will hang your corpse in the Wide - the Archduke's would-be assassin. The people will celebrate your fall, and my part in it.

35.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
35.text: Your bones will be a souvenir of what could've been.

134.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
134.text: Now, roll over and die - give up your life just as easily as you were ready to give up the stones.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: We can be allies but Ketheric and Orin's stones stay with me.

113.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
113.text: As they should. I was merely testing you. This should be an alliance of peers.
113.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

141.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
141.text: You've got a backbone, and the makings of a leader. The Dark Lord Bane blesses our alliance.

81.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
81.text: Our time is short. The elder brain is held beneath the city. We must go to it if we're to control it.

131.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
131.text: There is a vessel to the Morphic Pool, where the brain feeds. I will wait for you at the pool.

48.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
48.text: With the Netherstones in hand, the brain can't resist us. We will be Absolute, with an infected army at our beck and call.

18.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
18.text: First, we take Baldur's Gate, then Faerûn. All of Toril will soon follow. A thousand kingdoms, at our command.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Study Gortash. What are his intentions?

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *Half a smile shows he is teasing you. He doesn't think for one moment you'd fully submit to him, nor should a Spawn as formidable as you.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *You spot the hint of a smile. He is testing you - he wants you to refuse.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *There is no telling what schemes Gortash could be planning.*

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Study Gortash again. What more can you glean?

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Gortash studies you carefully in turn. He is shrewd and headstrong, and he expects the same of you.*

23.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
23.text: I will not tolerate weakness. A strong ally requires strong will.

73.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
73.text: One final test. Will they defy me and prove their worth, or will they cower?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Study Gortash. What are his intentions?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I will kill you and take your stone for myself.

36.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
36.text: And here I thought you could resist your Urge. I hate being wrong. I guess I'll have to make use of you in a different manner.

66.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
66.text: You choose death? What a terrible pity.

165.speaker: Minsc
165.text: The only thing I will hand you is my fist, tyrant. And there will be a sword in it.
165.context: NodeContext: First line delivered as if it's a snappy comeback. Second line is a necessary amendment in case his meaning wasn' t clear

19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
19.text: If he holds all the stones, he holds all the power. We must keep our portion if this alliance is to endure.

142.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
142.text: The brain awakens - we must act now.

130.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
130.text: My involvement with Orin was never a true alliance. A mad dog understands the yank of the leash and the hand of its master, but it cannot be an equal.
130.context: NodeContext: dismissive of Orin, glad she's now dead

145.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
145.context: NodeContext: heavy emphasis on 'you' - 'you' to the exclusion of all others

128.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
128.text: We will raise a Black Keep in Baldur's Gate. Then we will conquer the Sword Coast, and unite all its peoples under our rule. But first -
128.context: NodeContext: Triumphant. Interrupted by an earthquake on the last word

80.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
80.text: So much might, so much power. Together, we might have been great. We could have shaped the Coast in our image.
80.context: NodeContext: exasperated that a potential alliance has fallen through

62.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
62.text: But you failed to retrieve Orin's Netherstone. What a waste.

42.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
42.text: But you failed to deliver Ketheric's Netherstone. What a waste.

21.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
21.text: But you had to make a mess of things. What a waste.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Don't be rash. We might benefit from an alliance.

127.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
127.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I did what I had to. I have no regrets.

157.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
157.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

94.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
94.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I -
94.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'm not done making messes, Gortash. Your blood on this floor, for instance.

60.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
60.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

135.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
135.text: I warned you. You could have walked away.

110.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
110.text: But your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever alliance we might have made fell with it.
110.context: NodeContext: barely containing his anger - he's been betrayed, and is furious

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Don't be rash. We could be good for each other.

112.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
112.text: Good for each other? Don't be -
112.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

29.speaker: Player
29.text: For what it's worth, I think I always liked you, too. But this is how it must be.

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *There is hesitation in his eye for one moment. A passing thought of all times spent together you'll never remember.*

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I did what I had to. I have no regrets.

107.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
107.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

22.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
22.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I -
22.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

25.speaker: Player
25.text: An alliance? All I want is your head.

103.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
103.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

140.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
140.text: A partial resonance. You carry Thorm's Netherstone.

33.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
33.text: Yet you've returned without Orin's. This was not the agreement.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Give me more time. I'll come back when I have Orin's stone.

28.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
28.text: I gave you time - and you used it to snub my word and bring my Iron Throne to ruin.
28.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

26.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
26.text: I gave you time - and you used it to sow chaos at my Iron Throne.
26.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

78.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
78.text: I gave you time, but you used it to strike at my Steel Watch.
78.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

111.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
111.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear parents.

149.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
149.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear father.

108.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
108.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear mother.

129.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
129.text: I gave you time - and yet here you stand, with only whinging to show for it.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I didn't believe you. That you have always wanted me to rule by your side.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Forget your bargain. You had no intention of honouring it.

5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
5.text: I am a man of my word. I had every intention.
5.context: NodeContext: Angry - he's speaking the truth and has been betrayed

10.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
10.text: Yet you snubbed my warning and brought my Iron Throne to ruin.

57.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
57.text: The brain awakens. It's time I take matters into my own hands.

163.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
163.text: We could have moved mountains, we could have shaken the planes. And you chose imperfection.

43.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
43.text: Yet you sowed chaos at my Iron Throne. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.

84.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
84.text: Yet you struck my Steel Watch. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.

118.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
118.text: Yet Orin still lives, still holds her stone. You blatantly mock the terms of my bargain.
118.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

37.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
37.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I speak; you obey.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I'm done playing these games, Gortash. This ends now.

39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
39.text: This was no game. My word was my bond.
39.context: NodeContext: Angry - he's speaking the truth and has been betrayed

169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it does not gleam, but remains as it is. He lowers his arms.

27.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
27.text: Not a single flash of resonance. Not only do you not carry Thorm's Netherstone - you don't carry Orin's.
